title: High Livestock Production Index
description: Malawi's livestock production index reached 190.08 in 2022, indicating a significant increase compared to the 2014-2016 baseline of 100.

title: Low Patent Applications by Nonresidents
description: In 2016, Malawi recorded only 1 patent application by nonresidents, highlighting limited foreign interest in local innovations.

title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Secondary Schools
description: In 2018, Malawi had a pupil-teacher ratio of 72.31 in secondary schools, indicating potential challenges in providing quality education.

title: Negative Transaction Costs for Remittances
description: In 2023, Malawi experienced an average transaction cost of -49.69% for sending remittances, suggesting potential data anomalies or unique financial conditions.

title: Decline in Per Capita Real Income Growth
description: Malawi's per capita real income growth rate was -6.11% in 2019, indicating a decline in economic well-being for the population.

title: Minimal Child Employment in Manufacturing
description: In 2015, only 0.07% of economically active children aged 7-14 were employed in manufacturing, reflecting low child labor rates in this sector.

title: High Part-Time Employment Rates
description: In 2020, 76.09% of Malawi's workforce was employed part-time, with 82.82% of females and 69.59% of males working part-time, indicating a flexible labor market.

title: Negligible Merchandise Export Residuals
description: In 2020, Malawi's merchandise export residuals were effectively zero, suggesting efficient export reporting and minimal discrepancies.
